Sodium nitrate.description: Added to processed meats to stop bacterial growth. Linked to cancer in humans.

Sulfites.description: Used to keep prepared foods fresh. Can cause breathing difficulties in those sensitive to the ingredient.

Azodicarbonamide.description: Used in bagels and buns. Can cause asthma.

Potassium bromate.description: Added to breads to increase volume. Linked to cancer in humans.

bromate.description: Added to breads to increase volume. Linked to cancer in humans.

Propyl gallate.description: Added to fat-containing products. Linked to cancer in humans.

BHA.description: A fat preservative, used in foods to extend shelf life. Linked to cancerous tumor growth.

BHT.description: A fat preservative, used in foods to extend shelf life. Linked to cancerous tumor growth.

Propylene glycol.description: Better known as antifreeze. Thickens dairy products and salad dressing. Deemed ‘generally’ safe by FDA.

Butane.description: Put in chicken nuggets to keep them tasting fresh. A known carcinogen.

Monosodium glutamate.description: Flavor enhancer that can cause headaches. Linked in animal studies to nerve damage, heart problems and seizures.

Disodium guanylate.description: Also used in snack foods, and contains MSG.

Enriched flour.description: Used in many snack foods. A refined starch that is made from toxic ingredients.

Recombinant Bovine Growth Hormone (rBGH).description: Genetically-engineered version of natural growth hormone in cows. Boosts milk production in cows. Contains high levels of IGF-1, which is thought cause various types of cancer.

rBGH.description: Genetically-engineered version of natural growth hormone in cows. Boosts milk production in cows. Contains high levels of IGF-1, which is thought cause various types of cancer.

Refined vegetable oil.description: Includes soybean oil, corn oil, safflower oil, canola oil, and peanut oil. High in omega-6 fats, which are thought to cause heart disease and cancer.

Canola.description: Derived from the rapeseed plant. Often used in cooking and food processing. Some concerns about its high omega-6 content.

Safflower oil.description: Extracted from the seeds of the safflower plant. High in monounsaturated fats, which may have health benefits, but also high in omega-6 fatty acids.

Peanut oil.description: Extracted from peanuts. Contains monounsaturated fats and vitamin E. May be allergenic for some individuals.

Sodium benzoate.description: Used as a preservative in salad dressing and carbonated beverages. A known carcinogen and may cause damage our DNA.

Brominated vegetable oil.description: Keeps flavor oils in soft drinks suspended. Bromate is a poison and can cause organ damage and birth defects. Not required to be listed on food labels.

Brominated oil.description: Keeps flavor oils in soft drinks suspended. Bromate is a poison and can cause organ damage and birth defects. Not required to be listed on food labels.

Olestra.description: Fat-like substance that is unabsorbed by the body. Used in place of natural fats in some snack foods. Can cause digestive problems, and also not healthy for the heart.

Carrageenan.description: Stabilizer and thickening agent used in many prepared foods. Can cause ulcers and cancer.

Polysorbate 60.description: A thickener that is used in baked goods. Can cause cancer in laboratory animals.

Camauba wax.description: Used in chewing gums and to glaze certain foods. Can cause cancer and tumors.

Magnesium sulphate.description: Used in tofu, and can cause cancer in laboratory animals.

sulphate.description: Used in tofu, and can cause cancer in laboratory animals.

Chlorine dioxide.description: Used in bleaching flour. Can cause tumors and hyperactivity in children.

Paraben.description: Used to stop mold and yeast forming in foods. Can disrupt hormones in the body, and could be linked to breast cancer.

Sodium carboxymethyl cellulose.description: Used as a thickener in salad dressings. Could cause cancer in high quantities.

Aluminum.description: A preservative in some packaged foods

Aluminium.description: A preservative in some packaged foods

Mercury.description: Can damage the kidneys and nervous system.

Dibutyl phthalates.description: Disrupt hormones and damage the reproductive system.

phthalates.description: Disrupt hormones and damage the reproductive system.

diethylhexyl phthalates.description: Disrupt hormones and damage the reproductive system.

Isobutyl and isopropyl parabens.description: Disrupt hormones and harm the reproductive system.

phenylenediamine.description: M- and o-phenylenediamines irritate and sensitize the skin, damage DNA, and can cause cancer.

Sulfates.description: Used as surfactants and are used for lathering purposes.

Triclosan.description: An endocrine disruptor and a skin irritant.

Toluene.description: Can cause birth defects and blood cancer.

Lead.description: Found in lipsticks and can lead to poisoning.

Oxybenzone.description: An endocrine disruptor and can cause damage to coral reefs.

Octinoxate.description: Another endocrine disruptor and can cause damage to coral reefs.

Octocrylene.description: Can produce free radicals that can damage cells and cause mutations.

Avobenzone.description: Considered less harmful than some other sunscreen chemicals, but can still cause skin irritation and allergic reactions in some people.

Polyethylene Glycol.description: Can cause cancer and respiratory disorders.

PEG.description: Can cause cancer and respiratory disorders.

Diethanolamine.description: A cancer-causing agent and a respiratory toxin.

Alcohol.description: Can leave the skin dry and flaky.

Hydroquinone.description: Associated with developmental toxins, hair loss, and scalp burns.

Petrolatum.description: Can prevent absorption of moisture and cause dry skin.
